Identification.LongTitle: Consumer Products Containing Lead (Contact with Mouth) Regulations

Provision.Text: His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Health, pursuant to section 5a of the Hazardous Products Actb, hereby makes the annexed Consumer Products Containing Lead (Contact with Mouth) Regulations.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in these Regulations.

Definition.Text: accessible part means any part of a consumer product containing lead that may be touched, licked, mouthed or swallowed in the course of the reasonably foreseeable use of the product.

MarginalNote.DefinedTermFr: produit de consommation contennant du plomb

Definition.Text: consumer product containing lead means any of the following products containing lead:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: products, other than kitchen utensils, that are brought into contact with the user’s mouth in the course of normal use;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: products intended for use in play or learning by children under three years of age.

ContinuedDefinition.Text: It does not include any of the following:

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: children’s jewellery within the meaning of the Children’s Jewellery Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: products subject to the application of the Glazed Ceramics and Glassware Regulations.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), each accessible part of a consumer product containing lead must not contain more than 90 mg/kg of lead.
An accessible part may contain more than 90 mg/kg of lead if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: lead is necessary to produce an essential characteristic of the part;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: no alternative part containing less lead is available; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the part does not release more than 90 mg/kg of lead when tested in accordance with standard EN 71-3:1994/A1:2000/AC:2002 of the European Committee for Standardization entitled Safety of toys – Part 3: Migration of certain elements, approved December 13, 1994, amended March 11, 2000 and corrected July 24, 2002.

Section.Text: These Regulations come into force on the day on which they are registered.
The Consumer Products Containing Lead (Contact with Mouth) Regulations1 are repealed.
